title: Arc Furnace
content: The **Arc Furnace** is a machine used to remelt whole blocks into different or more pure materials ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the copper block as shown in building tutorial **Power Input:** On top of the coil **Power Consumption:** 16MW during operation ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/FT7tKqH ## Recipes To smelt blocks, place them inside the furnace {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Cobblestone |Magma Block |- |Stone |Magma Block |- |Magma Block |Lava |- |Wet Sponge |Sponge |- |Sand |Glass |- |T.N.T. |Diamond Block™ |- |Sculk Catalyst |Budding Amethyst |- |Sculk |Cobweb |- |Smooth Stone |Deepslate |- |Cobbled Deepslate |Gravel |- |Calcite |Quartz Block |- |Polished Deepslate |Basalt |- |Blackstone |Tuff |- |Raw Copper Block |Copper Block |- |Raw Gold Block |Gold Block |- |Raw Iron Block |Iron Block |} <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4</small></sub></code>

title: Bugs
content: This is a list of all known bugs that are in T.E.R.F ---- # Small Bug It makes you small to the point where the game becomes harder to play ----2. Dem Flight Bug, It gives you infinite levitation until a map reset is called via jona or other sources like a STFR meltdown

title: C.R.R.
content: ## Description The <b>Catalyzed Redstone Reactor</b> or <b>C.R.R.</b> is an addon to the TERF datapack. Designed to be the second reactor after the [M.C.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/MCFR) utilizing the Helium-4 that it produces. It is a Matter Conversion Reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. The <b>C.R.R.</b> has three different parts, the Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and the Projector. You will need to constantly add Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls to the <b>C.R.R.</b> to keep it operational. ## C.R.R. Operations To begin the startup process, you will need to input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB of Helium-4 into the <b>C.R.R.</b> Be aware, there can be a 5% chance for the <b>C.R.R.</b> to potentially have a Startup Failure. The controls below describes what they affect. <b>Saturation Extraction Rate</b> - The rate that the Energy Collector extracts Saturation<br> <b>Catalyzer Injection</b> - Increases C. Catalyzer<br> <b>™B Projection</b> - Reduces Shield Stress by using up more F. Shield ## Emergency Operations ### Meltdown Core Temperature will increase the <b>C.R.R.</b>'s Shield Stress. If the Shield Stress reaches above 100%, it will begin to degrade the shield. Increasing Saturation Extraction Rate and decreasing Catalyzer Injection may help to decrease stress. You can also use Catalyzer Annihilation to decrease Saturation.<br> If you also run out of F. Shield, this will also cause the shield to degrade.<br> Once the shield breaks, this begins the process of the second stage of meltdown. You will need to perform restabilization before the <b>C.R.R.</b> reaches stage three meltdown. You will need to input water into the <b>C.R.R.</b>, activate Catalyzer Annihilation, and injecting reaction inhibitor, once these are completed it will proceed to shut down the <b>C.R.R.</b> <br> If you fail to input water and use the Catalyzer Annihilation, the <b>C.R.R.</b> will reach stage three meltdown, it is best to evacuate the area as the core is unable to be saved. The <b>C.R.R.</b> will begin to leak out rays that can injure personnel and damage the area around it. After a while, the reactor will blow up and leave behind a crater. ### Stall If you run out of C. Redstone or have 0% saturation, the reactor may begin to stall. Unlike the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR), this will not lead to the reactor freezing. It will then give you two options: remove the key and shut down the reactor or reignite the reactor again. ### Startup Failure There is a 5% change for startup failure to occur. If this does happen, this will start to cause the shield to form unstable, to prevent the <b>C.R.R.</b> from summoning a Resonance Cascade, you will need to kill the green particles that fly around the room. Once they have been all removed, the <b>C.R.R.</b> will return to normal operation. ## C.R.R. Logistics There is no limit for Core Temp but the higher it goes, the more Shield Stress is gained. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, and Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer when it is low. ## Trivia The <b>C.R.R.</b> was inspired by the Anti Mass Spectrometer from the Half-Life series and the Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod. The **C.R.R** wasn't developed by Jona, instead it was coded by Cooocki and built by Kaiden

title: Crusher
content: The **Crusher** is a machine that squeezes items into dust using pistons. ## Technical **Multiblock Core Placement:** "the multiblock core goes in the bottom hopper, faces forwards" -Jona **Power Input:** Into the HVC Block **Power Consumption:** 10MW during operation **Activation:** Put the input item into the top Hopper. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Netherite Scrap | -> | Netherite Dust |- | Stone | -> | Cobblestone |- | Cobblestone | -> | Gravel |- | Gravel | -> | Sand |- | Wool | -> | 4x String |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Dust |- | Amethyst Block | -> | Amethyst Dust |- | Ice | -> | Snowball |- | Packed Ice | -> | 9x Snowballs |- | Bone | -> | 6x Bonemeal |- | Sugar Cane | -> | 2x Sugar |- | Blaze Rod | -> | 4x Blaze Powder |- | T.N.T. | -> | 5x Gunpowder |- | Redstone | -> | Red Dye |- | Raw Gold | -> | Gold Powder |- | Raw Gold Block | -> | 9x Gold Powder |- | Raw Iron | -> | Iron Powder |- | Raw Iron Block | -> | 9x Iron Powder |- | Raw Copper | -> | Copper Powder |- | Raw Copper Block | -> | 9x Copper Powder |- | Netherite Ingots | -> | 4x Netherite Powder |}

title: Diesel Generator
content: The **Diesel Generator** is a power-generating Multiblock in TERF. It constantly generates 6MW while the multiblock structure is [intact](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Multiblocks#Intactness). It has no stats or controls. The main purpose of Diesel Generators is to keep the facility operational while [the STFR](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [the DEM](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M) are offline, as well as during the aforementioned multiblocks' startup sequences. It can also be used as an alternative to a STFR or DEM in smaller bases. There are 4 Diesel Generators, placed back-to-back with the oxidised copper block part being [shared](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Multiblocks#Block_Sharing), in the TERF facility.

title: Electric Press
content: The **Electric Press** is used to press various items into other items ## Technicals **Mutliblock Core Placement:** Shown in Infobox image **Power Input:** Above top cut copper block **Power Consumption:** 1500 MWt every operation **Activation:** Each operation is activated by powering the piston ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | 1x Honeycomb | -> | 1x Slimeball |- | 1x Honeycomb Block | -> | 4x Slimeball |- | 8x String | -> | 1x Leather |- | 5x Blaze Powder | -> | 1x Blaze Rod |- | 1x Netherite Scrap | -> | 1x Ancient Debris |}

title: Electrolyzer
content: The **Electrolyzer** is a machine used to convert water into oxygen and hydrogen. <chem display#"inline">H2O -> 2H + O </chem> ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Please refer to the build tutorial **Power Input:** Conductor Block on the machine **Power Consumption:** *Unknown* {| class"wikitable" !Input Fluid !Output 1 !Output 2 !Processing Time |- |Water 30mb |Hydrogen 20mb |Oxygen 10mb |100 ticks |} ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/gallery/electrolyzer-build-tutorial-LAmKmya The multiblock core block has been highlighted in green for clarity

title: Extended Mainframe
content: **Extended Mainframe** is an unreleased addon which makes it easier to connect [server stacks](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mainframe]]_servers. ##_Content_ The_addon_allows_[[Mainframe#Servers) to reach a maximum height of 5 blocks and allows singular servers to be connected via the sides and top. ## Glitches While checks are in place to prevent connecting a server from the sides or top if the server is already connected from the bottom, it is possible to connect a single server 5 times by connecting it via every side and the top at the same time.

title: Fabricator

title: Fission Reactor
content: ## Fission Reactor (Lambda Core) The Lambda Core is used to transmute certain blocks into other blocks via neutron irradiation. ## Technicals **No power input/consumption or multiblock core.** **Iron blocks:** Absorbs neutrons. **Coal blocks:** Slows neutrons. **Lapis blocks:** Reflects neutrons. **Control rods:** Stops neutron emission when inserted into Fuel rods. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input: !Chance of Transmutation: !Output: |- |Ancient Debris | |Diamond Block |- |Copper Block | |Coal Block |- |Gold Block | |Ancient Debris |- |Wheat Crop | |Nether Wart |- |Sandstone | |Soul Sand |- |Oak Sapling | |Pale Oak Sapling |- |Brown Mushroom Block | |Warped Fungus |- |Red Mushroom Block | |Crimson Fungus |- |Dried Ghasts | |Ghast Tear |}

title: Hadron Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a machine in the TERF Facility, used to smash items into other items at high speeds to create new items. It is a major part of the [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process). ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards **Power Input:** Into the Interface as seen in tutorial video **Power Consumption(MW):** <math>Length \times 16</math> ## Build Tutorial

title: Large Fluid Solidifier
content: The **Large Fluid Solidifier** is a machine that turns liquids, such as [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water), into blocks, such as [Ice](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Ice). ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Lapis Block, facing towards the output conveyor belt. **Power Input:** Not needed. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Provide the machine with the correct amount of input liquid. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Fluid (amount mB) ! -> ! Output Block |- | [Water](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Water) (2,000 mB) | -> | Ice |- | [Mineral Magma](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mineral_Magma) (2,000 mB) | -> | Coal Ore (~34.5%) <br> Copper Ore (~32.7%) <br> Redstone Ore (~13.5%) <br> Gold Ore (~9.70%) <br> Iron Ore (~3.25%) <br> Diamond Ore (~2.99%) <br> Lapis Ore (~2.91%) <br> Ancient Debris (0.3%) |- |}

title: Machinery
content: ## Introduction: This page lists all current available machines on the Official server. Some machines may change over time or new machines get added so this page might not be up to date at all times! ## Machinery: [Arc Furnace](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Arc_Furnace) [Block Breaker](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Breaker) [Block Placer](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Block_Placer) [Charging Station](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Charging_Station) [Crusher](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Crusher) [Electric Press](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electric_Press) [Electrolyzer](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electrolyzer) [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator) [Fission Reactor](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fission_Reactor) [Hadron Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider) [Mainframe](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Mainframe) [Multi Piston](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Multi_Piston) [OpenCore](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/OpenCore) [Physical Connections](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Physical_Connections) [Purifier](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Purifier) [Rolling Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Rolling_Mill) [Wet Mill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Wet_Mill) [WarpCore](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/WarpCore) [The D.E.M](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M)

title: Magma Drill
content: The **Magma Drill** is a machine that extracts Mineral Magma from Lava. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone. Orientation doesn't matter. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block. **Power Consumption:** 70MW **Activation:** Active by default. Deactivate by moving fluid output. ## Recipes The input structure is a list of blocks, which should be placed from top to bottom. Place the input structure directly below the drill bit, (lightning rod) or the drill bit directly above the input structure. {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input Structure ! -> ! Output Fluid |- | 3 Blocks, Lava, Bedrock | -> | Mineral Magma |- |}

title: Mainframe
content: The **Mainframe** is a device used to link machines to each other. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the lodestone, facing towards the screens. **Power Input:** Not needed, despite the presence of HVC blocks. **Power Consumption:** None. **Activation:** Automatic, can be restarted by removing the multiblock core and adding it back again. ## Servers A Mainframe's usefulness depends on the number of connected servers. Each connected machine "consumes" servers through the mainframe. If you don't have enough servers to fufill the needs of all connected machines, the mainframe will crash, making a unique sound. The mainframe will then restart after 1 minute. To restart a mainframe sooner, remove the multiblock core and add it back again. Each mainframe starts with 2 servers, which are part of the multiblock structure. Additional servers can be added by placing L.O.O.M. servers above HVC blocks connected to the mainframe's own HVC blocks. HVC cables will not work for connecting servers to mainframes. L.O.O.M. servers can also be placed on top of other servers, making a server stack. Up to 3 servers can be in a single stack; additional servers are ignored and considered disconnected from the mainframe. ## Connection Machines can be connected to a Mainframe via [Data Connection](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Physical_Connections#Data_Connection)s. Data Connections are accepted through the waxed cut copper block, found at the bottom of the multiblock structure, as is common with machines that accept a data connection. ## Usage TBC

content: **Mineral Magma** is a custom liquid produced by [Magma Drill](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Magma_Drill)s.

title: Multiblocks
content: ## Summary Multiblocks are the core of TERF, enabling the operation of machines such as the [STFR](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_S.T.F.R) and [DEM](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_D.E.M). This page documents how multiblocks are made and operated. ## The Multiblock Core To create multiblocks, you first need a multiblock core. These can be made with the crafting table using the following recipe, or, once you have made a power generator and a [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator), you can use the more efficient fabricator recipe.

title: Netherite Refining Process
content: ## Summary The **Netherite Refining Process** is a step-by-step recipe for making netherite out of automatable resources using TERF. This process is what makes the creation of a [Warp Core](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/WarpCore) in survival possible. ## Ingredients The initial ingredients required to create netherite are listed below. {| class="wikitable" ! Resource ! Amount Per Netherite Ingot ! Amount Per Netherite Block ! Amount Per Warp Core (32 Netherite Blocks) ! Automation Method |- | Honeycomb | 9 | 81 | 2592 | Created in the TERF Facility's Biodome. |- | Coal/Charcoal | 12/~14 | 108/~124 | 3456/~3950 | Created by the [Large Fluid Solidifier](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Large_Fluid_Solidifier) or Smelted from Logs. |- | Redstone | 16 | 144 | 4608 | Created by the [Large Fluid Solidifier](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Large_Fluid_Solidifier). |- |} You will also need access to the following machines: * A Crafting Table or Crafter (used twice) * An [Open Core](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electric_Press]]_(used_once) *_A_[Hadron_Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider)_(used_twice/thrice) *_A_[OpenCore) (used once) ## The Recipe Listed below are the steps which are part of the recipe. ### Step 1 * Input: Honeycomb (9 per Ingot, 81 per Block, 2592 per Warp Core) * Machine: Crafting Table * Output: Honeycomb Block (~3 per Ingot, ~21 per Block, 648 per Warp Core) * Recipe: 4 Honeycomb -> 1 Honeycomb Block * Notes: Technically, you can also skip this step and do the next step with regular honeycomb, but this process is quite quick and speeds up the following step by a factor of 4. ### Step 2 * Input: Honeycomb Block (~3 per Ingot, ~21 per Block, 648 per Warp Core) * Machine: [Open Core](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electric_Press](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/OpenCore)_(used_once) ##_The_Recipe_ Listed_below_are_the_steps_which_are_part_of_the_recipe. ###_Step_1_ *_Input:_Honeycomb_(9_per_Ingot,_81_per_Block,_2592_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_Crafting_Table *_Output:_Honeycomb_Block_(~3_per_Ingot,_~21_per_Block,_648_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_4_Honeycomb_->_1_Honeycomb_Block *_Notes:_Technically,_you_can_also_skip_this_step_and_do_the_next_step_with_regular_honeycomb,_but_this_process_is_quite_quick_and_speeds_up_the_following_step_by_a_factor_of_4. ###_Step_2_ *_Input:_Honeycomb_Block_(~3_per_Ingot,_~21_per_Block,_648_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_[Open_Core](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Electric_Press) *_Output:_Slime_Ball_(9_per_Ingot,_81_per_Block,_2592_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_1_Honeycomb_Block_->_4_Slime_Ball ###_Step_3_ *_Input:_Slime_Ball_(9_per_Ingot,_81_per_Block,_2592_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_Crafting_Table *_Output:_Slime_Block_(1_per_Ingot,_9_per_Block,_288_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_9_Slime_Ball_->_1_Slime_Block ###_Step_4_ *_Input:_Charcoal_(~14_per_Ingot,_~124_per_Block,_~3950_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_[Hadron_Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider) *_Output:_Coal_(12_per_Ingot,_108_per_Block,_3456_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_4_Charcoal_+_4_Charcoal_->_7_Coal *_Notes:_Optional,_you_can_also_feed_the_following_steps_with_just_coal. ###_Step_5_ *_Inputs:_Slime_Block,_(1_per_Ingot,_9_per_Block,_288_per_Warp_Core)_Coal_(12_per_Ingot,_108_per_Block,_3456_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_[Hadron_Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider) *_Output:_Diamond_(2_per_Ingot,_18_per_Block,_576_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_1_Slime_Block_+_12_Coal_->_2_Diamond ###_Step_6_ *_Inputs:_Diamond,_(2_per_Ingot,_18_per_Block,_576_per_Warp_Core)_Redstone_(16_per_Ingot,_144_per_Block,_4608_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_[Hadron_Collider](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Hadron_Collider) *_Output:_Netherite_Scrap_(1_per_Ingot,_9_per_Block,_288_per_Warp_Core) *_Recipe:_2_Diamond_+_16_Redstone_->_1_Netherite_Scrap ###_Step_7_ *_Input:_Netherite_Scrap_(1_per_Ingot,_9_per_Block,_288_per_Warp_Core) *_Machine:_[[OpenCore) * Output: Netherite Ingot (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core) * Recipe: 8 Netherite Scrap -> 8 Netherite Ingot * Notes: This step is used only for efficiency and speed, you can also just use the normal gold recipe if you don't have an open core. You, however, would have to quadruple the rest of the recipe.

title: Non-Formal Template
content: {{DISPLAYTITLE:Template:Non-Formal Template}}

title: OpenCore
content: The OpenCore is a furnace that uses two positron emission units to remelt items many times more efficiently than basic methods. Use of OpenCore can consume from 1000MWh to 10000MWh ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the iron blocks at the bottom **Power Input:** Into the conductor blocks ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/RC9NZsx Note than the upper part is 4 blocks above the bottom part ##Usage To use OpenCore you need active S.T.F.R which produces more than 500 MWh (Varies depending on the recipe) {| class="wikitable" !Ingredient !Energy (MWh) !Result |- |8x Netherite Scrap |5000 |8x Netherite Ingot |- | 32x Glowstone Dust |2000 |24x Blaze Powder |- |4x Emerald Block |7200 |3x Diamond Block |- | 20x Quartz |900 |20x Amethyst Shards |- |4x Amethyst Block |6000 |1x Ochre Froglight |- |1x Netherite Block |10000 |1x Heavy Core |} If you meet the requirements, you can start-up OpenCore and start using it. After confirming start-up sequence, you will start getting temperature "orders" you need to meet. You can find them at sign above centre of control panel. If you fail to meet order you will face consequences. If recipe was simple (froglight, amethyst shards, blaze powder) you will just get small explosion/photons, else, if there was difficult recipe (netherite ingots, diamond blocks, heavy core) you will get medium/large explosion. Full tutorial: https://youtu.be/xkQwBeZJXUA <small>*Written by LogicLogger*</small> <small>*Corrections & build tutorial by Sony*</small>

title: Physical Connections
content: Most machines will need some physical connection to other machines, whether it's electrical, fluidic or digital. ## Basic Behaviour All connections connect in the same way, using omnidirectional connecting blocks and directed connecting blocks * **Omnidirectional Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will input and output from any side * **Directed Connecting Blocks** - these blocks will only input or output from two opposite sides ## Types <gallery> File:ElectricWires.webp|Electric Cables File:HotFluidPipe.webp|Hot Fluid Pipe File:ColdFluidPipe.webp|Cold Fluid Pipe File:DataConnection.webp|Data Connection </gallery> ### Electrical Cables * Used to electrically connect machines * Transfers electric power ### Hot Fluid Pipe * Used to connect the S.T.F.R. and Turbines * Transports Steam and Mineral Magma ### Cold Fluid Pipe * Used to connect Coolant Pumps and Turbines to S.T.F.R. * Transports Coolant ### Data Connection * Used to connect control panels and multiblock machines, usually operated by a mainframe <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub> __NOEDITSECTION__

title: Pressurizer
content: If the Pressurizer has oxygen it pressurizes an enclosed area ## Logistics **Multiblock core placement:** in the vent block on top, cut copper must be placed first, then the multiblock, then the vent block. {| class="wikitable" |+Fluid/Gas logistics: !Input fluid: !Storage capacity: |- |2mb of Oxygen/s |30mb of oxygen |}

title: Purifier
content: The **Purifier** is a machine that turns blocks into other blocks by bathing them in water. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the piston while facing the opposite direction that the piston is **Power Input:** Behind the piston **Power Consumption:** 5MW during operation **Activation:** Place the input blocks underneath the iron bars ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Input ! -> ! Result |- | Stone | -> | Calcite |- | Basalt | -> | Blackstone |- | Red Sandstone | -> | Netherrack |}

title: Rolling Mill
content: The **Rolling Mill** is a machine used to roll ingots into plates. ## Technical Information **Multiblock Core Placement:** In the center of the multiblock structure, at the bottom, facing towards the output hopper. **Power Input:** Into the HVC block below the input hopper. **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation. **Activation:** Put the input item into the input hopper. ## Recipes {| class="wikitable" |+ !Input !-> !Result |- | Iron Ingot | -> | Iron Plate |- | Copper Ingot | -> | Copper Plate |- | Netherite Ingot | -> | Netherite Plate |- | Gold Ingot | -> | Gold Plate |- | Uranium Ingot | -> | Uranium Plate |- | Plutonium Ingot | -> | Plutonium Plate |- |}

title: S.T.F.R. Logistics
content: WIP ## Technicals **Maximum Steam Output:** *Unknown,* conventionally used to generate 30 000 m°C/t of steam ### **Physical Connections:** #### Coolant Input Requires a constant source of coolant, it is recommended to connect the coolant pump to steam turbine coolant output to create an efficient loop #### Steam Output Steam is to be directed into turbines, each turbine can handle 5000 m°C/t of steam #### Mainframe Connection Must be linked with control panel in Mainframe #### Breaker Connection There must be a connection from breaker output to one of the stabilizers to enable startup and restabilization ## Build Tutorial The multiblock core goes into the end of the bottom stabilizer <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4 & Corrstud01</small></sub></code> __NOEDITSECTION____INDEX__ __NONEWSECTIONLINK__

title: S.T.F.R. Restabilization
content: ## Introduction: This page will explain all types of Critical Reactor Core states and their Restabilizations. All Critical Core states are caused by failing Shield Integrity. ## Overload: An Overload is usually caused by Reactor Core stats being out of safety parameters. Once a Reactor Overloads, all Core stats will run out of control as the Stabilizers are no longer able to contain the Core. The Case will start burning from the Heat and the Core will start to shoot beams of light. Stabilizer U and D currently do not have any connections they need and can be freely connected to. Your breaker input Stabilizer needs to be connected to and your mainframe connector input Stabilizer need to be connected. This also means your console will not work for the time being. Once all 4 Stabilizers are connected the reactor will automatically initiate a restabilization Power Surge. '''<u>Do not forget to reconnect your Controller or you won't be able to control your reactor</u>'''. <u>Again, a Power Surge will make your controls multiply by 10x!</u> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSJJZMk50MU ## Notes: * Shield Integrity will rapidly decrease if all stabilizers are broken while the Reactor is online. * During a Power Surge the Core will have 10x natural heating! ## Trivia: * Underload is also reffered to as Freezedown/Reactor Stall by the Community but Underload is the official name in the files <code><sub><small>Composed by Cooocki</small></sub></code>

title: S.T.F.R. Startup
content: Please note that this page is **<big>WIP</big>** Keep in mind that this guide is written specifically for the official map, while most of the steps will be applicable for a custom built setup, a few steps are reserverd specificallly for the official map In the meantime, you can refer to this fan-made Quick start tutorial PDF ### 5. Step - Press the SSTB button again This will initiate reactor ignition and start the core ## Common issues you might encounter ### *Breakers do not work* This can be caused by insufficient power directed to the breakers as they need atleast 24 MW of power, alternatively could be caused by breaker output connnection not being connected to the S.T.F.R. <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub>

title: S.T.F.R Stabilization
content: ## S.T.F.R. Controls The operation of the S.T.F.R. can initially look complicated at first glace. Firstly, the image below is the general control area that you will operate the reactor. if this occurs. ## Maximum S.T.F.R. Values <b>Core Spin</b>: 80,000 - 150,000 RPM <b>Core Temperature</b>: 15,000 - 110,000 °C <b>Core Pressure</b>: 280,000 kPa <b>Case Pressure</b>: 80,000 kPa <b>Case Temperature</b>: 1,000 °C ## S.T.F.R. Logistics For every 5000 RPM of <b>Core Spin</b> will give you 1% of <b>MSSR</b>, <b>Magnetic Shield Stress Reduction</b>, this will decrease <b>Shield Stress</b> that is made by Core and Case Temperature, Pressure, and <b>Core Spin</b> by 1%. It is recommended for <b>Core Pressure</b> to be double of <b>Core Temperature</b>. It is also recommended to monitor the <b>Fuel Usage</b> to match the rate of <b>Fuel Injection</b>. The amount of <b>Case Pressure</b> affects the <b>Heat Transfer Rate</b> (<b>HTR</b>) between the core and the case. For every 3m°C/t is equal to 1MW. One turbine can only handle 5000m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. The Troty Energy Research Facility have 6 turbines which adds up to 30k m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. It is preferred to keep <b>Cooling Lasers</b> off unless your <b>Case Pressure</b> is below 15-20 kPa.

title: Testing page (Do not touch)
content: The WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. ## Logistics: **Power consumption:** 10,000 MW/t per block. **Power storage:** 2,000,000 MW ## WarpCore Guide: Place the multiblock core in the WarpCore FACING the mainframe connection. The multiblock core for the panel goes facing towards the screens

title: The D.E.M
content: The D.E.M. is a black hole based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. # A massive warning that the info in the dem page is incorrect because it literally spreads misinformation ### Structure add a gallery when you get evenly square versions of the individual compopnents of the D.E.M. Component List of images to add * Proper Square Full Render * Core * Horizon Scrubber * Power Laser * Power Extractors * Stabilizer * Startup Manifold (Only if its easy to get) #### Core * This is the black hole core of the D.E.M. where hawking radiation for power generation comes from * This is only present while the D.E.M. is in operations, or as a ball of compressed matter during startup, which then gets compressed by gravitational amplification * The core is kept stable using a gravity shield that prevents the gravity of the black hole from extending past intended boundaries * The core is generally being orbited by the accretion disc, which is the disc of matter falling into the core to generate power, this disc can stall if complete desaturation is allowed, but the accretion disc can simply be reformed #### Horizon Scrubber * Prevents the atmosphere inside the room from reaching into the accretion disc, which would uncontrollably saturate the disc, potentially destabilizing the gravity shield by throwing core parameters out of control * It does not prevent anything from falling into it, allowing the accretion disc to be resaturated during operations using any form of matter #### Power Lasers * Stabilizes one part of the D.E.M.'s Operation, wether it'd be the accretion disc's rotational energy or thermal energy, or causing EMR flux in the core or feeding it some mass #### Power Extractors * Extracts power from the core using the emitted hawking radiation, due to how accelerated the hawking radiation decay process is, this generates a lot of power #### Stabilizers * Stabilizes the gravitational shield, preventing the black hole from tearing the facility and the planet apart #### Startup Manifold * Generates the accretion disc ### Operation Parameters #### Global Laser Offset * Offsets the lasers from the singularity of the core, eventually changing their modes across 4 different overall modes # Extremely Low Offset: Feeds the singularity directly, slightly increasing core mass # Low Offset: Enters the EMRIRS Without hitting the singularity, causing superradiant scattering within the EMRIRS and eventually exiting back out as EMR Flux # Medium Offset: Low leverage on the accretion disc, warming it up more than it adds rotational energy to it # High Offset: High leverage on the accretion disc, adding rotational energy more than it warms it up #### Global Power Laser * Acts as a general multiplier to the effect of the current laser offset's mode #### EMRIR Shield Density * Increases EMR Flux ** This would increase the accretion disc temperature based on how high this gets ** This would decrease the gravity shield's stress based on how high this gets #### Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage * Decreases Accretion Disc Saturation ** This decreases core spin due to having less matter to fall into the core *** This is also based on how fast the disc is spinning * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Field Compression Control * Increases hawking radiation by reducing core mass ** This increases power generation * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Electron Injection * Increases Reactor Charge ** This causes higher disc de-saturation ** This causes lightning bolt strike if get too high ( 9000-12000 ) ## Crucial Components Missing: Proper & Square D.E.M. Control Panel Image <gallery> File:Mainframe.webp|The Main Computer </gallery> ### Control Panel * Used to operate the D.E.M. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network <sub>First Edition Composed by loltnt_pvp</sub> ## Trivia # The D.E.M.'s full name is "Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor", SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR For short. ## Related Links Cooocki and FJSAGS have put together some notes on how D.E.M. works: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JwTdfeakhBpCm71j09fPvbVEmozJ9vUW4yS5e0n3jAc?tab=t.0

title: The M.C.F.R
content: ## Description The <b>Modular Catalyzed Fusion Reactor</b> or <b>M.C.F.R.</b> is the first reactor that players make in TERF. It is a boiling water reactor that reacts with Hydrogen to produce Heavy Steam and Helium-4, which is utilized in starting the [C.R.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/C.R.R.) <b>NOTE: The [C.R.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/C.R.R.) is an addon and may not be found in your TERF instance.</b> The <b>M.C.F.R.</b> has multiple parts. Firstly, one <b>M.C.F.R.</b> slab consists of four <b>M.C.F.R. Assemblies</b>, the picture to the side shows a three stack <b>M.C.F.R.</b> The <b>M.C.F.R.</b> has at least 4 inputs, power for preheating, hydrogen input, water input, and steam output. If any of these are not properly added or removed, this could potentially lead to over-pressure and damage to ventilation. If the vent's break, and if unable to fix in time will cause the <b>M.C.F.R.</b> to explode. The explosion size scales with how much hydrogen you have in the system and can be fatal to nearby operators. You can route the Helium-4 into a tank or smokestack if needed. <b>Warning! If Helium-4 is ventilated in the environment, it may suffocation. Please setup proper disposal of Helium-4.</b> Here is an example of a <b>M.C.F.R.</b> system.<br>

title: The S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R. is a fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility ### <big>Structure</big> <gallery> File:STFRrender.webp|The S.T.F.R. File:STFRCaseRender.webp|The encasing superstructure of S.T.F.R. File:Area render 11 .webp|The core of S.T.F.R. during operation File:StabiliserRender.webp|One of six S.T.F.R. stabilisers </gallery>The S.T.F.R. consists of 6 stabilisers, an encasing superstructure and the main core #### Core * This is the core of fusion reaction, where the main processes happen * This core is only present inside the superstructure when the reactor is in operation * The core consists of a shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core * The shield layer consists of one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields #### Case * The encasing superstructure is a sphere-like structure around the core of the reactor * As the core generates heat during operation, the heat is transferred to the case, where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines to generate power #### Stabilisers * The stabilisers play a crucial role in keeping the core in a stable state and preserving the integrity of core shields ## Crucial Components <gallery> File:BreakersRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Electrical Breakers File:CoolantPumpRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Coolant Pump File:ControlPanel.webp|S.T.F.R. Control Panel File:SteamTurbine.webp|Steam Turbine </gallery> ### Breakers * The breakers supply the S.T.F.R. with DC current * The__INDEX__y are only needed during startup or restabilisation * AC current is input at the bottom conductor; DC is output from the top conductor ### Coolant Pump * This pump pumps the coolant for the S.T.F.R. ### Control Panel * Used to operate the S.T.F.R. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network ### Turbine and generator * Upon heating up the [https://terf.fandom.com/wiki/The_S.T.F.R#Case reactor case], steam is produced and can be directed into turbines to generate power * Turbines have to be connected with steam pipes to the S.T.F.R. * Turbines have to be connected with coolant pipes to the S.T.F.R. <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub>

content: The **Vent Block** is a block used in the construction of various multiblock structures, notably [The M.C.F.R](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/The_M.C.F.R). ## Crafting The Vent Block is crafted using the following Crafting Table recipe:

title: WarpCore
content: ToDo: Layer by Layer build tutorial - SonyXM4 WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. It is inspired by "The Spire" from Portal: Revolution. ## Building The main challenge of building WarpCore is getting 32 netherite blocks. Everything else is obtainable from the storage. ## Full Resource List * **Netherite**: **32 Blocks** (see [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process)) * **Copper Coils** * **Ancient Debris** * **High Voltage Conductor Slabs** * **High Voltage Conductor Walls** * **Iron Bars** * Decorated pots * Whatever you need for an actual ship ## Usage FJSAGS and Cooocki have put together a guide on using the WarpCore: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19_ZigixmATimn0WH8QtrK6JksQ0ANh6BGBIhi3rnqlc/edit?usp#drivesdk ## Known WarpCores {| class"wikitable" ! Name ! Known Operators ! Status ! Status Date |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Cooocki, Jona | In possession of Jona | 22nd June, 2025 |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Ragn4Rockx | Destroyed. Cause: The shot of ART hit the core(s), which led to destabilization and explosion. | 20th March, 2025 |- | Unknown/Unnamed | Ronan | Unknown | 11th April, 2025 |- | "Neotheater" | Tobias, Cooocki, FJSAGS, LogicLogger | Destroyed. Cause: Failure when attempting to repair after a meteorite hit. | 20th March, 2025 |- | "OK Orchestra (3rd edition)" | Tobias, Cooocki (partially), FJSAGS, LogicLogger | Destroyed. Cause: ART shot in overworld | 16th April 2025 |- | "Quasar" | Corrstud | Bomboclat | 8th June 2025 |- | "Aurora" | | Adidas | 17th August 2025 |- |}

title: Wet Mill
content: This machine is used to pulverize fine crushed materials into very fine dust ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the pot **Power Input:** In the Conductor Block **Power Consumption:** 6MW during operation **Fluid Extraction:** Fluids are extracted below the decorated pot via. copper pipes **Cauldrons:** The cauldrons have to be full of water ## Recipes Items are inserted into the input hopper {| class="wikitable" !Input !Output |- |Gold Dust |Gold Slurry |- |*More recipes* |*Soon* |} <code><sub><small>Composed by SonyXM4</small></sub></code>

title: Wrench
content: ## Description The wrench is a tool that is used for changing block rotation and is also used for maintenance for the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR) ## Usage ### Maintenance While the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR) is online and there is no lubricant in the system, maintenance may occur and you will require to use a wrench to fix it. You will need to hold your place block button (normally right click) and point your cursor to the source of the particles. You will know if it worked once you hear hammering sounds and the particle source moves. ### Block Rotation If you hold your wrench and activate your place block button (normally right click), you can change the rotation of an item. This affects things such as stairs, trapdoors, and many other blocks. ## Fabrication To fabricate the Wrench, you will need to have a power source and a [Fabricator](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Fabricator). The recipe is two iron nuggets, iron pressure plate, iron ingot, lightning rod, and red dye. The location to place the items are in the picture below. <br>
